 # *Вибрати культуру*
 # *Ввести фактичний показник вологості:* будь яке значення більше ніж 99.99%
 # *Ввести показник сміттєвої домішки:* будь яке значення більше ніж 99.99%
 # *Натиснути кнопку "розрахувати"***

*Expected result*

*помилка про некоректний ввід данних*

*Actual result*

*Калькулятор видає результат розрахунку*
fields.summary: Не має обмежень по кількості та формату введених дани в полі вводу показника вологості

fields.description:
*Preconditions*
 # *Фактичний показник вологості 30%*
 # *Базисний показник вологості 8%*
 # *Базисний показник сміттєвої знижки 3%*
 # *Розрахунок проводимо за формулою Дюваля, що є на сайті*

*Steps To Reproduce*
 # *Відкрити сайт  : [http://nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html]*
 # *Вибрати культуру: "соняшник"*
 # *Ввести фактичний показник вологості* 
 # *Ввести показник сміттєвої домішки*
 # *Натиснути кнопку "розрахувати"***

*Expected result*

*Знижка має бути 23.91%*

*Actual result*

*Калькулятор видає 42.00%*
fields.summary: Error in discount calculation

fields.description:
As suggested by one of your team members [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Subtree-notifications/qaq-p/800661#M22044], I'm opening up a ticket for a feature improvement.

 

*Explanation:* I'm using the latest version of Sourcetree (2.7.4) with a repo that I'm hosting on Bitbucket (it's a Wordpress website project). My main project has a Subtree (a shared plugin that I use across multiple website projects). I was able to pull and push changes with the main repo as well as the subtree without a problem. What I noticed, however, is there is no indication/notification when new commits are available for pushing/pulling for the subtree. Let me explain:

When my main project (repo) has new commits available on the remote, Sourcetree displays a little notification in the sidebar, toolbar, and History, showing how many commits we are behind and that I there are new changes ready to be pulled. ([See image|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/22497i5498160032C68D93?v=1.0]).
 The same happens if I have new commits waiting to be pushed.

However, when working in my main repo project with the subtree, when the subtree's remote has new commits available, Sourcetree doesn't inform me about that. Nor does it tell me that I'd made changes to the subtree files that I should push to the subtree remote. So I have no way of knowing that there's an update to the subtree plugin that should be pushed/pulled.

 

*Feature Improvement Request:* Can we please add push/pull notifications for subtrees.
fields.summary: Subtree Push/Pull notifications

fields.description:
As suggested by one of your team members [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Subtree-notifications/qaq-p/800661#M22044], I'm opening up a ticket for a feature improvement.

 

*Explanation:* I'm using the latest version of Sourcetree (2.7.4) with a repo that I'm hosting on Bitbucket (it's a Wordpress website project). My main project has a Subtree (a shared plugin that I use across multiple website projects). I was able to pull and push changes with the main repo as well as the subtree without a problem. What I noticed, however, is there is no indication/notification when new commits are available for pushing/pulling for the subtree. Let me explain:

When my main project (repo) has new commits available on the remote, Sourcetree displays a little notification in the sidebar, toolbar, and History, showing how many commits we are behind and that I there are new changes ready to be pulled. ([See image|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/22497i5498160032C68D93?v=1.0]).
 The same happens if I have new commits waiting to be pushed.

However, when working in my main repo project with the subtree, when the subtree's remote has new commits available, Sourcetree doesn't inform me about that. Nor does it tell me that I'd made changes to the subtree files that I should push to the subtree remote. So I have no way of knowing that there's an update to the subtree plugin that should be pushed/pulled.

 

*Feature Improvement Request:* Can we please add push/pull notifications for subtrees.
fields.summary: Subtree Push/Pull notifications

Git-flow feature finish doesn't work with multiple sub directories

fields.description: When I select multiple commits and Sourcetree decides to refresh the view, it will unselect all commits except the first and the last. While this makes sense in the context of showing a diff of a range of commits, it doesn't make sense at all if I'm trying to cherrypick a bunch of commits instead.
fields.summary: Individual commit selection is lost on refresh

fields.description:
I find most commonly when I try and delete old local branches, that often there are 'unmerged changes' that prevent the DELETE operation.

This results in a failure, after which i need to action another 'Delete' on a local branch, this time checking the 'Force delete' checkbox.

This is a frustrating and repetetive task.

I wish it was easier/faster to clean up your local repo tree!
fields.summary: Indicate if Branch has unmerged changes (before 'delete' action)

fields.description:
change detail for commits before double renaming not viewable

This issue can be repeated using the git repo as attached. The repo contains two renaming operations on a file named a.txt. using "gitk --follow -p new_folder/a.txt" shows me the correct history with change details for all the involved commits.

Steps to repeat based on the attached git repo with uncommitted changes:
 # Download and unzip
 # open in SourceTree
 # Click "History"
 # Click "Uncommitted changes"
 # Right click on "new_folder/a.txt" in "Unstaged files"
 # In the newly opened window for viewing history of "new_folder/a.txt", check "Follow renamed files"
 # We can see three commits
 # Click and check what's on the right side commit by commit from top to bottom on the left side, when comes to the commit messaged "added a.txt", nothing is shown on the right side.
fields.summary: change detail for commits before double renaming not viewable

fields.description:
Cannot connect to Bitbucket account. Have tried to sign in several times I get the same error. Even when trying to adding a new account in. See attached.

Update: Added image as when using "Create" and uploading image there gave me a Jira Token error.
fields.summary: Authentication Completed with an Error

fields.description: I have a repo with two remotes, {{upstream}} and {{origin}} ({{origin}} is a fork of {{upstream}} in my own Github account). I also have a branch {{foo}} that tracks {{upstream/foo}} (not {{origin/foo}}). When I click the "Pull" button in the toolbar, the remote selected by default is {{upstream}} as expected, since the branch is tracking a branch on that remote. When I click the "Push" button however, I inexplicably get the {{origin}} remote selected by default. [According to git-config|https://git-scm.com/docs/git-config#git-config-branchltnamegtremote], the default remote for push should be {{branch.foo.pushRemote}} or if that is not set (it isn't), it should be {{branch.foo.remote}} (which is {{upstream}}, not {{origin}}), so I would expect the the push dialog to respect that and select {{upstream}} by default, which it doesn't.
fields.summary: Push via toolbar button does not respect branch.<name>.remote

fields.description:
- Plug a generic keyboard with a numpad in your macbook.

- open sourcetree create a branch and use the numpad the pop-up will disappear.

The commit text box is also affected, if I commit some files and type a number with the numpad the input desapear and I'm back to previous page. i.e if I was on search and click on commit then type with numpad the window go back to search screen.

So far only the search is fine, on left side if I select search and type with numpad the number are displayed.

I didn't check all the input but at least the one I regularly use.
fields.summary: MAC Os using external keyboard

fields.description:
I keep getting locked out of my corporate TFS account, because I am entering the wrong credentials. When I check the value saved into the keychain it is incorrect, not even close? A value was also saved to the keychain when I selected for the password not to be saved to the keychain.

I have marked this as the highest priority, as I am having to use different Git repository management software, as it is too disruptive to be kicked out of my corporate account each time I try and do a fetch.
fields.summary: Incorrect password stored in keychain

fields.description:
It would be great if we could group repositories in Projects.

I work on multiple projects and sometimes I have to scroll through a lot of repositories to find the one I want to use. If we could group them, it would be a lot easier to find the repository we need, for those who have a lot of repositories in their list.
fields.summary: Grouping of Repositiries

fields.description:
I was asked to create an issue via twitter when I reported that SourceTree erased my git history while testing it out.

For two different projects on my local computer, the .git directory had been deleted after viewing them via SoruceTree. 

Here's my use-case:

I have a handful of developers working on a variety of projects. All projects already use Git and the repositories are hosted in various locations. Some projects host repos on Bitbucket - which is one of the reasons why I was looking forward to using SourceTree. Other projects have repos on GitHub, and still others are privately managed by various hosting companies.

I'd like all the devs to be able to use the command line primarily, but also have a tool like SourceTree in their back pocket, for resolving merge conflicts and other tricky situations.

In this video, I am trying to reproduce the problems I ran into yesterday. I wasn't able to do so because I wasn't able to completely Uninstall SourceTree to start over. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KKpRuitgr0A

If you want me to try this again, please tell me how to completely uninstall!
fields.summary: Installing SourceTree for the first time on an existing project, .git directory was deleted.

fields.description:
*Summary*

After deleting a branch, the first time you select another branch in the left pane, the tree view does not update the selected commit.

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Open History View
 # Delete a branch (local or remote, right click > Delete on left panel)
 # Click on another branch in the left panel (local or remote)

*Expected behavior*

The selected branch in the left pane is selected in the tree view and scrolled to.

*Actual behavior*

The tree view does not update the selected commit or scroll to the branch.
fields.summary: Select branch does not navigate tree view after delete branch

fields.description:
When writing the commit's description, being able to press the tab key to move focus to the Commit button would be great. 

Putting a tab in said description doesn't seem to me to be really useful.  However, it would streamline check-ins if we didn't have to mouse so far away to the bottom-left of the window in order to complete the op.

Allow for dashes when pasting a story name in branch creation screen

fields.description: When comparing image diffs, the small thumbnail is very useful but I would love to see a larger image if I have made the window larger, and if the image is of a higher resolution. Attached are two screenshots, one of the current behaviour, and one demonstrating what larger previews would look like.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * "Diff against current" some branch or cmd+click some commit and "Uncommitted changed"
 * Select any file in produced diff
 * Switch to editor and make change in any file in repository (could be different from selected one)

Expected behaviour: diff tree is updated and if previously selected file presents in diff then it remains selected.

Actual behaviour: diff tree is updated and file selection is reset to the first file in the diff.

 

Revisiting changes before commit while making adjustments is my primary use case for SourceTree and losing progress on each change significantly reduces productivity.
fields.summary: Diff against current resets selected file on update

fields.description:
-I used to be able to take a local repo and add multiple remotes for it. I can't seem to do that anymore with SourceTree. I also can't seem to add a remote that isn't Github or Bitbucket.-

Never mind, I just couldn't find the commands until I opened the local repo and looked in the Repository menu. Not what I expected but you can close this ticket.
fields.summary: Can't add multiple custom remotes for one local repo anymore

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

 1. Open «Залізничні квитки» application

 2. Select in main menu «Вибір мови» then in submenu select «Українська»

 2. Select in main menu «Купити квиток» submenu

 3. Type in submenu «Звідки»: «Львів»

 4. Type in submenu «Куди»: «Київ»

 5. Select in submenu «Дата»: «17 травня 2018»

 6. Select in submenu «Час з»: «00:00»

 7. Press «Пошук поїздів» item

 8. Obtain a list result with available according to selected dates and hours trains from selected stations.

 9. Select in main menu submenu «Вибір мови» then change the language to «Англійська»

Expected result: All information in the list result and in main menu should be in English

Actual result: Station names in the list result remain in Ukainian.
fields.summary: Menu items do not change the language when changing the application language

fields.description:
В приложении "Укрзалізниця", подбор поездов и построение маршрута с пересадкой между городами, в одном из которых больше одной станции, осуществляется не корректно. При условии если в выбраной станции поездов по маршруту не имеется, производиться подбор маршрута с пересадкой, в том числе и между станциями одного и того же города.

STR:
 # Открыть приложение "Укрзалізниця".
 # В поле поиска (Откуда) ввести город Кривой-Рог.
 # В поле поиска (Куда) ввести город Долинская.
 # Выбрать дату 1 мая.
 # Нажать кнопку "Поиск поездов"
 # В окне "Выбор поезда", выбрать поезд с маршрутом Кривой Рог-Кривой Рог Главный-Долинская.

AR: Строится маршрут с пересадкой между станциями одного города.

SR: Маршрут строится только между станцией города ,через которую поезд проходит, и городом поиска. В данном случае Кривой Рог Главный-Долинская.
fields.summary: В приложении "Укрзалізниця", подбор поездов и построение маршрута с пересадкой между городами, в одном из которых больше одной станции, осуществляется не корректно.

fields.description:
STR: При условии если приложение только установлено или в поля поиска ещё не вводились значения.(Присутствуют пустые поля поиска)
 # Открыть приложение "Укрзалізниця".
 # В одно поле поиска "Откуда" или "Куда" ввести название любого города, второе поле оставить пустым.
 # Нажать кнопку "Поменять местами" (↓↑).

AR: Пустое значение пропадает и город дублируется.

ER: Пустое значение и город меняются местами.
fields.summary: В приложении "Укрзалізниця", если ввести в поиск (Откуда или Куда) любой город, а второе поле оставить пустым, при нажатии кнопки "Поменять местами" (↓↑) город дублируется.

fields.description:
I access a remote repo for a company I do a lot of work with. The repo's been active for a long time and I use it regularly. After I downloaded the latest update, I open Sourcetree and click the remote tab. It asks me to authenticate my Github account which I do and I get the error message: 

message: Requires authentication

[https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/#list-your-repositories]

 

I click 'sign-in' and add my credentials which are accepted and gives me a 'Authorize SourceTreeForMac screen and lists the repo but the 'Authorise Atlassian' button is disabled
fields.summary: Can't authorise Sourcetree for remote repo

fields.description: The "Add / Remove" (stage all) functionality is a frequently used one but the key command is a bit awkward. Would be nice to get a simpler one.
fields.summary: Simpler key command for stage all

fields.description: Without any force push option in the main page, I often accidentally have "push changes immediately to..." checked accidentally and upon an amend attempt, I encounter not just one but two modal alerts in a row. If these could be merged, it would be less disruptive when it occurs.
fields.summary: Avoid second modal alert when failing to enable force-push

Ожидаемый результат: Дисплей устройства не изменит яркость.

Фактический результат: В альбомном режиме, приложение делает яркость дисплея максимальной, при том что она стояла на минимуме. Также яркость нельзя поменять в строке состояния ( ползунок уровня яркости не двигается).

5. Fill the gap “E-mail” - annademchuk28@gmail.com

6. Fill the gap “Password” - Ukukuk

7. Fill the gap “Confirm password” - Ukukuk

8. Click the button for accept the Contract offer and allow using personal data 

9. Click the button “Send”

 

Expected result: Error message: “Please use upper case, lower case letters and numbers for creating your password”.

Actual result: The form color is changed to red, no error message, can’t create User profile.
fields.summary: No error message when creating incorrect password

fields.description:
We're talking about "Filter repositories" window — the one which appears when you open Sourcetree when you have some repos already added.

Currently, mis-typing a single letter of a repo name means that it won't be displayed in the search findings list.

*Let's implement a fuzzy search!* It's already implemented on pretty-much all other apps of the workflow (code editors, Alfred and whatnot) so users will be familiar with and appreciate it.
fields.summary: Implement a fuzzy search on "Filter repositories" window

fields.description:
At my company I support multiple (21+) teams working on different team forks and each team has 21 repositories.

As such the Local Repositories folder feature is invaluable to keeping my work sorted out (thank you), but it would be nice if I could view and/or edit the bookmarks.  This would help me confirm which team fork the local repository was cloned from.

In general one of my greatest frustrations with Source Tree is that I don't know what is going on behind the scenes.  For example (and this may be a GIT issue) I don't know what was the source branch for a branch I created.  So anything that helps me be able to understand where things come from or where they are going would be helpful.

 

Thank you
fields.summary: Display and/or Edit bookmark properties

fields.description:
It's sometimes needed to look up or change the repository url. Way more often than to change the commit template. In the repository settings it would be nice if the "Remotes" tab would come first (like it used to, before commit templates were introduced).

!tabs.png!
fields.summary: Order of Tabs in Repository Settings
Можно приобрести билет на имя и фамилию состоящую либо только из английских букв, схожих по начертанию с русскими, либо написать часть русских и часть английских букв.
При выборе номера вагона в приложении UZ, в скобках указывается всегда количество "місць", а должно быть например " 1 місце, 2 місця, 5 місць"

fields.description:
STR:

1.Открыть в браузере сайт [https://www.ttt.ua|https://www.ttt.ua/].

2. В поиске вбить и выбрать: [Смартфон Samsung Galaxy J7 Neo (SM-J701FZDD) Gold|https://www.ttt.ua/shop/product/mobilnyi-telefon-samsung-galaxy-j7-neo-gold-sm-j701f-ds].

3. Нажать кнопку купить.

4. В окне корзины в правом верхнем углу нажать: добавить или убрать количество товаров (кнопки "+" "-")

AR: Лента с дополнительными товарами обновляется и меняет структуру на таблицу, в течении 2.5 - 3 секунд возвращается в исходное состояние.

ER: Лента с дополнительными товарами обновляется не нарушая свою структуру.
fields.summary: В окне корзины (при наличии товара), лента с дополнительными товарами при обновлении работает не корректно.
Convert all to SSH breaks all the remote actions

fields.description:
When dragging and dropping files, e.g. from Finder to a gDrive folder (i.e. a Chrome browser window), if the dragged set even hovers over SourceTree, it will grab focus and not let go.  The only recourse is to painstakingly drag the file set back to original Finder window (effectively cancelling the drag operation), and then go hide/move the SourceTree window so that it doesn't try to grab the set of files being dragged.

This behavior is a royal pain.  I'm not even sure why dragging and dropping files into the SourceTree window is even a supported operation.
fields.summary: Drag and drop behavior in SourceTree is wrong

fields.description:
AEM (Adobe Experience Manager) uses loads of files named ".content.xml". Unfortunately, when I select such a file and try with "Log Selected" to get a log of such an file or try to use "Annotate selected", I get the error message:

"Potential security issue detected in the specified URL. Sourcetree determined this URL is in an unsupported format."

Could you please allow the use of such files? Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Can't create a log of a file named .content.xml

fields.description:
When I fetch from a remote, I would like the option to prune the remote's branches so my local copy matches exactly what's on the remote. The equivalent command line option for {{origin}} would be:

{{git fetch origin --prune}}

Ideally, I'd like the *Fetch from _remote_* context menu item to bring up a dialog with fetch option(s), including *Prune branches*. However, I'd be willing to do this as a custom action, if only custom actions were a) available on remotes, and b) had a {{$REPO_NAME}} option, instead of just {{$REPO}}, which gives me the path to my local repo, which is not what I need in this case.

 

See also:
 * SRCTREE-1114
 * SRCTREE-1481
 * SRCTREE-3131
 * SRCTREE-4062
 * SRCTREE-4189

It appears there's a fair bit of desire for pruning.
fields.summary: Want fetch <remote> --prune

fields.description:
When I create a local branch from a remote one with a different name then when I push it the default proposed name isn't the remote one in the remote branch column, see attached screen shots to reproduce.

The GIT config file seems correct regarding local and remote names:

[branch "spark_local"]

   remote = origin

   merge = refs/heads/spark

Workaround: the correct branch name is in the proposed list.
fields.summary: Correct remote branch name is not proposed by default in push dialog box.
Wrong result of changing the font size

fields.description:
Any user can install the application after download it on computer.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Open [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/]
 # Choose correct modification for Mac OS downloading
 # Click button "Download"
 # Open SourseTree installation file
 # Click button "install"

Expected result: successful completion of all installation steps and the working version of the application SourseTree at the end

Actual resalt: the aplication is not installed and can't be used
fields.summary: SourceTree -  The application is not installed after downloading on Mac OS

fields.description:
It would be nice if in the local repository view matched the remote repository view in that it shows you the account name as a heading and then which repositories belong to that account beneath it.

I happen to need to manage multiple accounts and the remote view is very useful to me and I would find it especially useful in the local view as well for when I am working day to day.

The image attached helps visualise what I am describing above.
fields.summary: Show which account each repository is associated with on local view

fields.description:
Selecting a file that is stored in Git-LFS in sourcetree, then right-clicking and selecting "Log Selected" gives the error: 

"*Potential security issue detected in the specified URL."*

*"*Sourcetree determined this URL is in an unsupported format."

Log Selected has always worked (and still works, for non-LFS files) fairly reliably. I've repro'd this on SourceTree 2.7.1/2/3 Mac with multiple different repos. Don't have my Windows box handy to verify on Windows.
fields.summary: SourceTree "Log Selected" doesn't work on files in Git-LFS

fields.description:
Selecting a file that is stored in Git-LFS in sourcetree, then right-clicking and selecting "Log Selected" gives the error: 

"*Potential security issue detected in the specified URL."*

*"*Sourcetree determined this URL is in an unsupported format."

Log Selected has always worked (and still works, for non-LFS files) fairly reliably. I've repro'd this on SourceTree 2.7.1 Mac with multiple different repos. Don't have my Windows box handy to verify on Windows.

 

Note that no sensitive URLs area actually used - I think this is sourcetree failing to recognize a URL to a file revision via git lfs.
fields.summary: SourceTree "Log Selected" doesn't work on files in Git-LFS

fields.description:
It looks like someone did a design pass on the main SourceTree UI, where all the commits are listed, and decided adding a bunch of white space would be "nicer" in some way.

I use SourceTree professionally, so productivity is paramount to me, not aesthetics.  Reducing the amount of info on the screen so that I have to scroll more, and so that I can see less of our team's overall commit flow is a huge loser for me.  Maybe the designer should look at the density of info on a typical developer's screen in the Terminal and/or IDE windows.

Is there a preference somewhere to restore the previous layout?
fields.summary: New layout of main commit view is bad for productivity

fields.description:
I have several Git remotes for Heroku apps, but I haven't logged in via heroku-cli. Sourcetree prompts me to enter credentials for each remote and if I click Cancel, a new one will appear. I don't want to log in. I want to disable those prompts. Currently I'm not able to use Sourcetree.

The prompts contain:
Authentication Required
For URL: [https://git.heroku.com/...]
Username:
Password:
[ ] Store Password In Keychain
Cancel / OK
fields.summary: Authentication Required prompt for each Heroku Remote renders Sourcetree unusable

fields.description: Resolving conflicts with external merge tool using Araxis Merge broke for me in the past two weeks. Araxis Merge does not start. Perhaps I upgraded Araxis Merge recently - I can not remember. I am using Araxis Merge 2018 Pro (2018.4971) for "El Capitan or later" and SourceTree 2.7.2 (167). I am using High Sierra - that may be the culprit.
fields.summary: External merge using Araxis Merge 2018 does not work on OSX

fields.description:
I have 2 accounts that I use with bitbucket. However, when I use Auth Type oAuth, connect my account, I can't change the SSH Key. The reason I want to do this is because there is an issue with the SSH Key that is attached to the account that SourceTree is defaulting.

When I go to copy that SSH Key, I get this:

-----BEGIN RSA

 

That's it, nothing else. So in which case it fails for both my accounts. I have generated 2 different keys and have them both linked to their respected bitbucket account (one personal, one work), but since I cannot change them in SourceTree, I have to resort to HTTPS for my repos.
fields.summary: SSH Key Bug

fields.description:
I have 2 accounts that I use with bitbucket. However, when I use Auth Type oAuth, connect my account, I can't change the SSH Key. The reason I want to do this is because there is an issue with the SSH Key that is attached to the account that SourceTree is defaulting.

When I go to copy that SSH Key, I get this:

-----BEGIN RSA

 

That's it, nothing else. So in which case it fails for both my accounts. I have generated 2 different keys and have them both linked to their respected bitbucket account (one personal, one work), but since I cannot change them in SourceTree, I have to resort to HTTPS for my repos.
fields.summary: SSH Key Bug

fields.description:
You are currently using circles to accent active branch. 

Having color coded circles that match the colors in the timeline would make it so much easier to understand the timeline. 

Possibly using the same circles or maybe colored background behind the branch name or the font color of the branch name - there are many options and each one would make it so much easier to understand the timeline.
fields.summary: Color coding branch names with same colors as the timeline
[Interactive Rebase] Commits with no message is not included in the list of commits
Merged PRs not showing as merged

fields.description:
The auto-diff in the File status makes the SourceTree pipeline jerky and maddening slow at times.

When I click on one file, it takes 3 seconds to view the diff, including 1 second during which the app is unresponsive (beach ball on mac).

Recently, I had to do a batch Revert operation on 100 out of 110 files and selecting them, triggered an insane auto-diff process which would make my SourceTree completely  unresponsive. I add to do it by batch of 5 and even then there's an unacceptable hang of at least 10 seconds for each selection. 


Either make this diff a parallel process that doesn't block the user or allow users  to deactivate the auto diff; and pick the timing at which they want to diff.

As an example of possible implementation:

On top of a master option in Preference, If auto-diff is turned off, a text should appear  in the background of the diff panel with a button 'Visualize chunks/differences'. Upon clicking, it would process the diff for the selected files. 

 

Thanks
fields.summary: Allow user to deactivate/limit auto diff in File Status

fields.description:
We have 2 Bitbucket Server systems - one for production and one for staging tests of functionality, upgrades and plugins.

After a user adds their separate account for each to Sourcetree, there's never any way of telling the accounts apart (see attached screen shots). In the accounts view, they're virtually identical, and drilling down into the accounts only shows the username/password/connection type.

If you need to change the user, password, or connection type for one of them, you'll never know which account you're editing. There needs to be more non-generic server info in both of the contexts shown in the screen shots.
fields.summary: In SourceTree account prefs, different Bitbucket servers can't be told apart

fields.description:
Recent versions of SourceTree show the commit history double space (in History view.) This halves the number of commits I can view at one time, so I have been reverting to 2.6.3.

 

Have the line endings been changed to cr+lf (carriage return + line feed) instead of the standard Mac lf (newline only)?
fields.summary: History is double spaced since version 2.7

fields.description:
the translation of git commands in Italian language in the interface are sometimes compeltely wrong (i.e. "Committa" is not an Italian word) and sometimes may cause ambiguity or errors. For instance, "git merge" now seems to be translated in "unisci" in the sidebar contextual menu but the git command I want to execute is "merge" (as is named in the menu bar or in the history tree contextual menu. In my opinion translating git commands in the interface cause users to question "how do they have translated the command ?" without any guess. To me this vanify the advantages of using sourcetree, since I have to memorize all the subjective translations for the standardized git commands and I should revert to the command line to be sure to execute exactly what I mean.

thanks

Stefano
fields.summary: Italian translations are wrong or debatable

fields.description:
Please consider changing the word 'file' to 'changes' in the Unstaged Files overflow menu. The current wording of "Discard file" right next to "Remove file" is confusing. Only one of them actually does anything to the file.

!Screen Shot 2018-04-10 at 3.54.53 PM.png!
fields.summary: Wording Change

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Open SourceTree
 # Open multiple repos, let's say (repo_a, repo_b, and repo_c)
 # Close some repos, let's say (repo_b)
 # Wait for SourceTree to crash
 # Re-open SourceTree

h3. Expected result

SourceTree should re-open repo_a and repo_c.
h3. Actual result

SourceTree re-opens repo_a, repo_b, and repo_c.

Since this only reproduces when SourceTree crashes, I'm not 100% sure that it is opening repos that were open when SourceTree last cleanly closed. It definitely opens repos that were previously closed, which can be quite frustrating.
fields.summary: Closed repos are re-opened after a crash

fields.description: While in Dark mode, every screen has a dark background except for "File Status" screen when there is nothing to commit.
fields.summary: Dark Theme: File Status background is white when "Nothing to Commit"

fields.description: The "Date" column in the "History" section of the main window doesn't honor system date settings. It always seems to use 12-hour time, even if the computer is set to use 24-hour time throughout.
fields.summary: SourceTree's "Date" column shows time wrong

fields.description:
As a user working on multiple projects across different languages and frameworks and along with disparate dev teams with different coding style conventions, I'm often required to apply different white space rules mainly:
 * tabs vs spaces
 * number of spaces in a tab

These options are just two of the greater number of rules that can be defined within an {{.editorconfig}} file. The [ editorconfig|http://editorconfig.org/] project/standard is supported by a growing number of applications (both native and cloud-based) including GitHub, which will read an {{.editorconfig}} file (if present) and apply its rules when displaying, for instance, diffs. This is extremely helpful when working with code that specifies, for example, tabs with a width of 8, instead of simply applying a default tab width of 4, *which is what SourceTree appears to do*.

On the outset, it seems that the spacing rules may be the only rules that need to be honored. More investigation is required to determine if the application of additional rules is also desired or needed.

Original question regarding this feature appears in the Community forums:

[Any plans to add support for editorconfig files to SourceTree?|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Any-plans-to-add-support-for-editorconfig-files-to-SourceTree/qaq-p/769386?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_answer&utm_content=topic]
fields.summary: Support for editorconfig files to adjust whitespace when viewing code

fields.description:
This is transferring a bug from #BBS-75239.

Please read the issue log from that.

The issue has come up all over again...

 

!image-2018-04-08-23-14-25-406.png!
fields.summary: Too many invalid password attempts.

fields.description:
Sourcetree asked me to upgrade to 2.7.2, but after that I could not push to my remote anymore. It said "could not read Password for ... : Device not configured"
I downgraded to 2.7 and it immediately worked again.
fields.summary: Sourcetree 2.7.2 breaks security chain

fields.description:
I had an older version of SourceTree working (2.67).  This was the only version that worked.

Anyways, I opened [www.bitbucket.com|http://www.bitbucket.com/] and it broke up my SourceTree OAuth login.  Basically, my compute started asking to store SourceTree credentials in KeyChain.  No matter what I typed for a password, SourceTree no longer is able to do a pull.

I updated to 2.71, deleted my keychain entries for Bitbucket and it still doesn't work.  I get the keychain prompt repeatedly regardless if I put my computer password or the Bitbucket password.

Thanks,

Jan-Michael
fields.summary: Can't login with 2.71
Add Shortcuts for Toolbar Buttons and Hints On Hover for Them

fields.description:
Would be please possible to add tooltip with information about tracked branch when mouse is hovering over local branch name in list of local branches?

 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Show tracked branch as tooltip on branch

fields.description:
When examining the contents of git commits, running "Log Selected..." on files with names that begin with a period results in a dialog box with the following error:

 

*Potential security issue detected in the specified URL.*

Sourcetree determined this URL is in an unsupported format.

 

To reproduce, select a git commit that contains a file with a name beginning with a period (e.g. ".gitignore"), right-click on that file and select "Log Selected...".

Spotted in SourceTree for Mac 2.7 (152), but this may affect other versions.
fields.summary: "Log Selected" on files beginning with . results in unsupported URL format error

fields.description: Would be nice to have all my repos in one window (with tabs) instead of multiple windows.
fields.summary: Tabs for different repos

fields.description:
When I try to clone repository from URL is asks for password 3-4 times. Then says "This is not valid source path/URL". If I try to connect to remote is says 

Could not authorize request with the available token. Please re-authenticate.

The password is correct. I've changed is 3-4 times already.

That started about 4-5 days ago.

And I cannot attach screenshots of the problem here, because it says "JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again."
fields.summary: Cannot login to remote or clone from url

fields.description:
My problem is, that I've two different Bitbucket accounts with two different SSH keys. The keys were generated with SourceTree and the config was edited by SourceTree. In my opinion the changes which are applied on the SSH config are wrong, for example if I add the accounts the config looks like following snippet:
{code:java}
Host username1-Bitbucket
...

Host username2-Bitbucket
...{code}
So, if I clone any repository using "git clone git@bitbucket.org:team/path" this won't work because the host doesn't match. So this is a bug - this actually will never work on macOS High Sierra.

There are tons of problems out in the net, where many developer are getting the error "access denied (public key)" occurs since macOS Sierra. Every Mac user will get this error if he is adding a new account via SourceTree. Please solve this.

 

If this isn't a bug, than the improvement will be valid. If I click "Clone" in bitbucket.org, I always use "open in SourceTree". Then there is the wrong URL (git@bitbucket.org) entered, because it doesn't match with the config above. Instead: git@usernamex-Bitbucket:team/path - than it should match.

Problem here is, that this won't work with submodules. The URL stored in the .gitmodules file must match the original URL for other users. If another user clones the repo via SourceTree, the URL with which the submodules will be initialized must be resolved by the prefix of the SSH config file (like above, username1-Bitbucket), so that the correct SSH key will be loaded to the agent.

 

I know it's a little bit tricky, but for me and also my colleagues - for them which have also a private account - it's very annoying. We always have to change the SSH config file if we want to communicate with the other account. Changing the URL while cloning by our own is also not a perfect solution because is very inconvenient and not really usable with submodules.

 

Would be nice to hear back soon - problem exists since 1 1/2 years.

Thank you very much.
fields.summary: Enter a remote URL is really annoying with two different accounts

fields.description: no option for  git  push --force-with-lease in Mac sourcetree
fields.summary: git push --force-with-lease

fields.description:
- [OP] Checking out a remote branch containing a '&' character shows "Invalid remote branch". Checkout using terminal with quoted branch names fixes the issue.

- [Brian Ganninger] We’re enforcing the rules outlined here for security: [https://git-scm.com/docs/git-check-ref-format …|https://t.co/wL8IAU6rWJ]. If memory serves, ‘&’ is below 40 in ASCII. Adding an option to quote is a good enhancement request, there’s a link to the ticket tracker in Help menu.

 

reference: [https://twitter.com/glenncoppens/status/981109739097591810]
fields.summary: Quote branch name upon remote checkout to allow '&' character in branch names

fields.description:
steps to reproduce:

1) create a git repository and enable git flow

2) start a new release with git flow

3) do some changes and commit them (in the release branch)

4) finish the release, the delete branch checkbox is selected

result:
 * the release branch is merged into master

expected result:
 * the release branch is merged into master
 * master is merged into develop
 * release branch is deleted

 

maybe it is related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-7976
fields.summary: Finishing a release using embedded Git Flow and embedded Git fails

fields.description:
I sign in to an account using SourceTree's preferences/Accounts. I push, and things work fine. Then a little while later, I try to push again, and get this garbage:

 

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree push -v --tags Bitbucket refs/heads/develop:refs/heads/develop 

Pushing to [my Bitbucket repo]

remote: Too many invalid password attempts. Try logging in through the website with your password.

fatal: unable to access [my Bitbucket repo]: The requested URL returned error: 403

Completed with errors, see above
fields.summary: "Too many invalid password attempts. Try logging in through the website with your password."

fields.description: When changing the currently active branch through the SourceTree UI, the branch label on the main SourceTree screen (where the list of repositories are shown) does not update. Restarting SourceTree causes the branch label to update to the correct value.
fields.summary: Branch name does not update in main SourceTree view

fields.description: Add an option to allow merging 2 bracnhes that have an unrelated history via thie git option --allow-unrelated-histories in the UI of the windows version of SourceTree.
fields.summary: Add option to --allow-unrelated-histories via UI

fields.description:
Currently when using sourcetree on my vertical monitors to browse the 'File status' section, it is tricky to be able to see the 'pending files' and 'diff review' windows in full. This is because the window is narrower so they take up a lot of room.

It would be nice to be able to change these from horizontally arranged to vertically stacked, one on top of the other, that way there would be less wasted space and more ability to be able to just scroll vertically to view more content in both sections.

I've attached two screenshots to better demonstrate the current issue and proposed solution.

*Vertical monitor example with wasted space*

!DZSqxFfX4AIsCPG.jpg|width=607,height=893!

 

*Vertical monitor example with saved space*

!DZSqyc3W0AU7Uez.jpg|width=608,height=895!
fields.summary: Allow the file status 'pending files' and 'diff review' windows to be vertically stacked

fields.description:
Browser label 'Repository moved or deleted" - not updating.

 

To reproduce:
 # Move a project to a different folder
 # Open browser and open the project with the 'Repository moved or deleted'
 # Select the correct folder.
 # Label 'move or deleted' persists. Reopening the browser does not refresh the label.
 # Only a complete App restart would update the label.
fields.summary: Label 'Repository moved or deleted" - not updating.

fields.description: The highlighted area in the attachment has no click and drag capability, while the rest of the title bar does. In other words, clicking and holding the area that says "Sourcetree" does not allow me to move the window around.
fields.summary: Title area in title bar does not click and drag the application

fields.description:
I created a new organization and a new repo. Cloned to my computer with a starter Jekyll site. Went to push changes to Github but got a 403 error with the GUI. However, a normal git push through the CLI works. Both use the same git account.

SourceTree Output:

Pushing to [https://ndkline@github.com/InnovativeReelTechnologies/history.git]
remote: Permission to InnovativeReelTechnologies/history.git denied to ndkline.
fatal: unable to access 'https://ndkline@github.com/InnovativeReelTechnologies/history.git/': The requested URL returned error: 403

Note, I had done this process with another organization a few days ago with success, however in that case the organization was created months ago.
fields.summary: Push to organization repo gives 403 error. User is owner and only member. Pushing through CLI works, not via GUI
Running command git add -A, file renames are messed up

fields.description:
If the {{pull.rebase}} setting is configured to true, SourceTree will perform a rebase-merge, even if the _Rebase instead of merge_ setting is not selected.

IMO, SourceTree should pass {{--rebase=false}} / {{--no-rebase}} by default, or {{--rebase=true}} if the user explicitly asks for it.
fields.summary: Pull merge/rebase setting defaults to gitconfig value, not “merge”

fields.description:
Would be possible to mark branches in list of branches and under remotes on left side of ST main window somehow with same color they are represented in graph in Log/History window?
I'm thinking about something like dots in proper colors, see attached screenshot.
 
The thing is, when I'm looking to history and the "last commit in branch" markers are not visible, I don't know which branch is which in Log/History window... And when you have more then 2-3 branches, I personally am lost...
fields.summary: Coloring branches in list of branches

I'm thinking about something like dots in proper colors, see attached screenshot.
 
The thing is, when I'm looking to history and the "last commit in branch" markers are not visible, I don't know which branch is which in Log/History window... And when you have more then 2-3 branches, I personally am lost...
